source.7d208238:
THE TITANIC

RMS Titanic was a British passenger liner operated by the White Star Line that sank in the North Atlantic Ocean on 15 April 1912, after striking an iceberg during her maiden voyage from Southampton to New York City. Of the estimated 2,224 passengers and crew aboard, more than 1,500 died, making the sinking at the time one of the deadliest of a single ship and the deadliest peacetime sinking of a superliner or cruise ship to date. With much public attention in the aftermath the disaster has since been the material of many artistic works and a founding material of the disaster film genre. We are going to disect this dataset to understand this disaster better..............

source.db0efa31:
Explaining the Columns

1> **PassengerID** - Unique id assigned to every passenger 2> **Survived** - Target variable (0 - if the passenger died , 1 - if the passenger survived) 3> **PClass** - Passenger class (1- Upper Class , 2- Middle Class , 3- Lower Class) - Fun Fact > Class 3 ticket costed around 15 to 40 dollars. 4> **Name** - Passenger Name 5> **Sex** - Gender of the passenger 6> **Age** - Age in years 7> **SibSp** - Number of the passenger's siblings and spouse 8> **Parch** - Number of parents and children for the passenger 9> **Ticket** - The Ticket Number 10> **Fare** - Ticket cost for the passenger (need to confirm my 'Fun Fact') 11> **Cabin** - Passenger's Cabin Number 12> **Embarked** - The port where the Passenger set sail (C, Q and S)
